title: Bump y18n from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1 in /oauth-service
body:
Bumps [y18n](https://github.com/yargs/y18n) from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1.
Changelog

Sourced from y18n's changelog.

Change Log

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. See standard-version for commit guidelines.

5.0.5 (2020-10-25)

Bug Fixes

  • address prototype pollution issue (#108) (a9ac604)

5.0.4 (2020-10-16)

Bug Fixes

  • exports: node 13.0 and 13.1 require the dotted object form with a string fallback (#105) (4f85d80)

5.0.3 (2020-10-16)

Bug Fixes

  • exports: node 13.0-13.6 require a string fallback (#103) (e39921e)

5.0.2 (2020-10-01)

Bug Fixes

  • deno: update types for deno ^1.4.0 (#100) (3834d9a)

5.0.1 (2020-09-05)

Bug Fixes

  • main had old index path (#98) (124f7b0)

5.0.0 (2020-09-05)

⚠ BREAKING CHANGES

  • exports maps are now used, which modifies import behavior.
  • drops Node 6 and 4. begin following Node.js LTS schedule (#89)

Features

  • add support for ESM and Deno #95) (4d7ae94)

... (truncated)

This version was pushed to npm by oss-bot, a new releaser for y18n since your current version.

In this case it would be helpful to know which slack application is needed, to request to add it or to update the slack subscription

title: Some issues from my security team
body:
1) It looks like a 3rd party is in control of the slack redirect when requesting an OAuth token for your account. This has the client scope which means it has access to pretty much everything. Is it possible to run this redirect service ourselves on a server we can control?

2) There is telemetry being utilized that sends data to mixpanel. From looking at the code it does seem possible to turn this off and we would need to make sure that is the case.

title: Bump highlight.js from 9.15.10 to 9.18.5 in /webview
body:
Bumps [highlight.js](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js) from 9.15.10 to 9.18.5.
Release notes

Sourced from highlight.js's releases.

10.3.2 - Oops, "Javascript".

Tiny tiny release, just to fix the website incorrectly not listing Javascript in the list of languages you could choose for a custom build. NPM and CDN build should not have been affected so 10.3.1 is effectively the same as 10.3.2 for those builds.

If you made a custom build from the website with 10.3 or 10.3.1 you may want to check and make sure it includes Javascript, and if not, build it again.

9.18.1 - Brrrrr, it’s freezing.

Quick release to resolve #2375

Changelog

Sourced from highlight.js's changelog.

Release v9.18.5

Version 9 has reached end-of-support and will not receive future updates or fixes.

Please see VERSION_10_UPGRADE.md and perhaps SECURITY.md.

  • enh: Post-install script can be disabled with HLJS_HIDE_UPGRADE_WARNING=yes
  • fix: Deprecation notice logged at library startup a console.log vs console.warn.
    • Notice only shown if actually highlighting code, not just requiring the library.
    • Node.js treats warn the same as error and that was problematic.
    • You (or perhaps your indirect dependency) may disable the notice with the hideUpgradeWarningAcceptNoSupportOrSecurityUpdates option
    • You can also set HLJS_HIDE_UPGRADE_WARNING=yes in your envionment to disable the warning

Example:

hljs.configure({
  hideUpgradeWarningAcceptNoSupportOrSecurityUpdates: true
})

Reference: highlightjs/highlight.js#2877

Release v9.18.4

Version 9 has reached end-of-support and will not receive future updates or fixes.

Please see VERSION_10_UPGRADE.md and perhaps SECURITY.md.

  • fix(livescript) fix potential catastrophic backtracking (#2852) [commit]

Version 9.18.3

  • fix(parser) Freezing issue with illegal 0 width illegals (#2524)
    • backported from v10.x

Version 9.18.2

Fixes:

  • fix(night) Prevent object prototype values from being returned by getLanguage (#2636) night

... (truncated)

Commits
  • f54e96c 9.18.5
  • c34318b fix the link since i saw it
  • d2e9bdd include date of last release
  • f5e0645 typos and tweaks
  • 2e0e8ee changelog
  • dc45f7c fix(livescript) fix potential catastrophic backtracking
  • 0a2624a update readme
  • d571b23 add warning
  • ec0bfd5 9.18.4
  • 2a04835 bump v9.18.3
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: [vscode] Can't Sign in with Slack  - Error: could not handle the request
body:
When I try to `Sign in with Slack`, everything proceeds fine, except when I click `Allow` in my browser, I get `Error: could not handle the request`

I had previously had `Chat` working, however, I had to re-install my mac and now I get the above error.

I'm wondering if Slack doesn't like me trying to `Allow` again, but I can't find any existing integration or permissions type things within Slack to remove.

Does any one have any ideas on how to fix this please?
Cheers!

title: Adopt VS Code's 'asWebviewUri' API
body:
Hi, I maintain VS Code's Webview API

## Issue
Our telemetry suggests that your extension uses webviews and may be loading resources in these webviews using hardcoded `vscode-resource:` URIs. These URIs have some important limitations and don't work properly when VS Code is run in a browser. We are also making changes in the desktop version of VS Code that may cause these URIs to not work properly in future versions of VS Code.

While we are making our best effort to continue support existing webview extensions that use `vscode-resource:` URIs on desktop versions of VS Code, we will not able to fully support all uses cases.

## Fix
To ensure that your extension continues to work in as many environments as possible—including on web and remotely—please:

- Switch to use the [`Webview.asWebviewUri` function](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/307cb32f306a527a30a5b1756e8bf548c141192c/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L6703) for loading resources.

- Switch to use the [`Webview.cspSource` property](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/307cb32f306a527a30a5b1756e8bf548c141192c/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L6714) in content security policies.

These APIs shipped around 2 years ago so they should be available in all modern versions of VS Code. You can find additional information about the issue here: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/97962

Let me know if you have any questions about this change

title: Name of person displayed as hash and other instabilities
body:
I am on MacOS Mojave 10.14.16 using VS Code 1.43.1 with Live Share Pack 0.3.4 (Live Share Chat 0.33.0).

When I start a live share, sometimes the chat tab does not open at all. Sometimes it opens but remains blank. It then seems to be stuck waiting for something. And sometimes it opens normally and I can start typing. Anybody seen this behavior before?

When it opens but remains blank, I tried to close the tab and then click "Chat channel" to open it again. But usually, it either opens blank again or doesn't open at all.

It happens when I start a live share, and it also happens when I join a live share. Some days it seems to mostly work, and somedays it never works.

I've never received any error message from the chat.

So that is the first problem, the most severe one. The second problem is the following...

When it does work, I can always see my name in the chat, for all of my posts, but most of the time I don't see the names of the other participant's posts, what I see instead is a user specific hash. Sometimes, I dont even see this hash, all I see in that case is the time of the post. But sometimes, I can see the name of the poster. Am I the only one to experience such erratic behavior?

Moreover, I always see the names of the participants in the LiveShare left side-bar. So the problem appears to be within the chat itself. 

When I join a share, I usually see the name of the share host inside the chat, but the names of the other posters are hashes. Today we made several tests and it happened to me and both other participants. One was on Windows and the other on Linux. So it seems that there is definitely a problem with the chat, it is not just with my setup. But it may be more severe on MacOS, since the other participants told me that their chat always opens normally. 

BTW the audio chat is also intermittent for me, but not for my two coworkers on Windows and Linux. Perhaps it is related. I will file a separate bug report for the audio chat, but here is a summary. On the left side-bar it tells me that I am connected to the audio chat, I can hear the others, but they can't hear me. And then suddenly, today, my machine asked me to allow Electron to access my microphone!? And then, it started to work very well, but not for every session. Again there is something flaky. When it doesn't work, I close the session and have to try again until the others can hear me. 

Before today, I was never asked to allow Electron to access my microphone. I checked the privacy settings and they now say that Electron is allowed to access the builtin microphone. I don't know if this setting was on before, but I have no microphone issues with any other app.

Hope someone can fix this because I really need this feature to be stable and dead simple for my students to use.

Best regards, 
MP

@jramsay -- FYI, I reverted the Live Share changes and released 0.33.0, which is a recovery build that has Live Share integration. Will release 0.34.0 (which will remove the Live Stare integration), once the Live Share release is out. Parking the changes in this PR for now.

body:
- Removes VSLS Chat and VSLS Contact Provider in preparation for Integrated Chat
- Rename 'Live Share Chat' to 'Chat'
- Remove VSLS specific viewlet chat injection
- Suppress some commands from showing up in the Command Palette that appear to be internal

@arjun27: Maybe I shouldn't be removing the VSLS Contact Provider? I've tested this works with the integrated chat but haven't verified Slack, Spaces (& Discord) are still working as expected. I was having trouble 'Signing in to Slack' as you mentioned the oAuth redirection isn't working. I wasn't quite sure how to get a Slack Token. Can I get your help with Slack & Spaces testing?

title: Add to Slack button doesn't add to Slack
body:
I was trying to use the extension with Slack and followed the instructions to add it to our Slack channel. When I click on the "Add to Slack" button, I am redirected to the [marketplace page](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=karigari.chat) and nothing is added to Slack.

The screen where the "Add to Slack" button is:

![Annotation 2020-03-13 162717](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/216028/76640471-e65a9180-6547-11ea-8779-003ed4bae704.png)

title: No way to re-open the chat panel when it's been closed
body:
I accidentally closed the chat panel during a shared session and I don't seem to have any way to open it again.

This is on Windows 10, VSCode 1.43.0

title: [request] Add support for IRC servers.
body: As old as IRC is, it's still used by thousands of developers. As there is a glaring [lack of IRC plugins on Visual Studio Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/search?term=irc&target=VSCode), supporting it will be a milestone for the project.

title: Sign in with Slack: Server IP Address Could Not Be Found
body:
After using the Sign in with Slack command and allowing the integration, I get a Chrome error that "vscode.chat’s server IP address could not be found. DNS_PROBE_FINISHED_NXDOMAIN"

Google has a cached version of vscode.chat, but I am unable to resolve the name if I try to reach it in a browser or find it with ping or nslookup

title: Discord: Invalid WebSocket frame
body:
testing to see if I have any better luck with this extension since discord chat stopped working and I started to get extension host crashing. I am unable to get discord to work at all... In the Team Chat output window, I get this error about every 7 seconds...

`Live Share Chat: [ERROR] Discord: Invalid WebSocket frame: RSV2 and RSV3 must be clear`

title: Extension issue
body: Never mind, VS Code copied the wrong error details

title: Extension issue
Privacy Policy Request
body: I was wondering if you had a privacy policy that you could supply to our security team for review. At minimum, can you provide a diagram of how the flow would look for a pair of programmers utilizing vs code and slack?  Specifically, please focus on ports and encryption in all phases of the interaction.

title: Typing status events for Live Share
DMs on Live Share
body: closes #438

title: Opening the chat view should not run "setup" on all chat providers
DeprecationWarning: Buffer()
body: console.ts:137 [Extension Host] (node:2482) [DEP0005] DeprecationWarning: Buffer() is deprecated due to security and usability issues. Please use the Buffer.alloc(), Buffer.allocUnsafe(), or Buffer.from() methods instead.

body:
Reference implementation at

https://github.com/vsls-contrib/spaces/blob/master/src/contacts/messaging/ContactMessageManager.ts#L48

Maybe we should also merge the presence and chat providers for LS

title: Support for at-mentions
body:
to dos

- [x] convert textarea -> contenteditable so we can enclose at-mentions in special spans
- [ ] send message to extension host when a message with an at-mention is sent (can be hooked up to notifications etc, by the chat providers?)
- [x] improve styling of the list
- [ ] how will this work with slack?

body:
to-dos before we can merge

- [x] clicking on external links is broken after refactoring

title: Rename extension to "Live Share Chat"
body:
It's been a year since the first version of this extension was released. The extension was built to solve context switching: I saw myself and many other developers constantly switch between their editor (usually VS Code) and team chat (usually Slack) – because building software is a team sport, and talking to your team about code is a natural part of writing/reviewing code. While it "made sense", bringing Slack to the editor sounded like a weird idea (it still kinda does). Incidentally, the webview API had just become stable, and it became possible to ship something like this. I rationalized the weirdness – if it wasn't weird someone else would have done it already – and convinced myself it was worth a shot.

The last year was full of milestones. Soon after the first release, we saw [feature requests](https://github.com/vsls-contrib/chat/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Achat-provider) to support new chat services, and that became a reason to modularize how the extension was built. It made sense to broaden applicability and go beyond Slack, since the goal was always to bring your team closer to code, wherever they may be.

Just as I was thinking of adding support for more chat services, the Slack legal team reached out flagging a trademark violation. "Slack Chat for VS Code" sounded too close to being a product from Slack, and I had to rename it. With support for Discord as the second chat service, the extension became "Team Chat".

Along the way, the extension found an early fit with the Live Share user community, where users were looking for an [integrated chat](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/live-share/issues/69). The impact of being added to the [Live Share extension pack](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=MS-vsliveshare.vsliveshare-pack) cannot be understated, and that is the main reason why the extension has ~150k unique installs today.

With the [Live Share extensibility API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/liveshare/reference/extensions), it became possible to run chat for Live Share users without depending on Slack/other chat services, and Live Share became the third chat provider. Today, chat on Live Share is about ~10x bigger than Slack (next most popular), and the fit seems to be only getting stronger.

To emphasize this fit, and optimize growth with Live Share, "Team Chat" will become "Live Share Chat". Support for other chat providers will continue, but the onboarding and documentation will reflect the focus to Live Share.

In the near term, this means:

- [x] Move extension to vsls-contrib org
- [x] Update package.json for marketplace listing
- [x] Update readme

Longer term, this means the extension can focus on Live Share as the first provider, and the code can reflect that focus. So far, a lot of the code is built to manage _n_ chat providers, and going forward I would like to emphasize Live Share as the first provider, so that Live Share reliability is not compromised.

title: Extension host terminated unexpectedly
body:
I kept seeing this error when I started VS Code. Searching the issues I found 
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/77099 and a [suggestion to disable chat](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/77099#issuecomment-514844205) which worked for me. So it seems likely that the cause of https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/77099 is this extension.

Possibly related: 
- https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/77547
- https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/77768
- https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/77019

It's also possibly not this extension. But it's a common element and disabling / uninstalling seems to fix.

title: Extension updating Slack status to away throughout the day
body:
For the past few months, my team has been battling an issue where Slack randomly (and quite frequently) marks us as away/inactive, even while we are using our machines. We find ourselves having to manually set ourselves to available in the Slack UI multiple times a day. We thought it was a bug with a recent update of Slack, but after some back and forth with their support folks, they informed us that this extension can cause the issue we are seeing.

Showing whether people are active on slack is great, but we use the normal slack app and rely on its presence-detection, so if this app is trying to update our status for us (irrespective of the presence Slack is already tracking in its own app), that eliminates this as an option for us. At least for now. It just causes too much confusion.

Let me know what other information we can gather to help troubleshoot this.

title: Fix usages of 'setup'
body:
Closes #318 

This PR fixes all usages of "setup" I could find, as detailed in #318 (turns out there aren't actually that many). Some things I left alone:

* mentions in `CHANGELOG.md`
* variables like `SETUP_DISCORD`, since I guess that could be interpreted as "variable regarding setup: discord"

Let me know if there's any other changes you want me to make!

title: "set up" instead of "setup"
body:
Perhaps a little pedantic, but "setup" is a noun/adjective, i.e. "follow the setup instructions", and **"set up"** is the verb, i.e. **"Set up Slack"**

https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/setup
https://grammarist.com/spelling/set-up-vs-setup/

I can open a PR to fix these

title: Unable to @ mention other users or paste files from clipboard in Discord
body:
Hi,

In Discord you can begin to @ someone and view an autocomplete field that helps you pick a user with their discriminator (#xxxx). As of right now, if I @ someone's username, they will not receive the mention as the real Discord client must format it in a certain way for it to be recognized as a mention. I would like to suggest adding this functionality.

In addition you can Cmd+V into the chat bar to paste an image or file. I would like to have that in vscode-chat as well.

No pressure, just a low priority feature request. I searched through previous issues and couldn't find anyone suggesting this so I figured I could be the first :)

Thank you again!

title: Feature Request - Mute Distracting Channels
body:
As far as I can see there is no way to mute channels. Even my already muted channels in Discord show up in the extension. I'm in a Discord server where out of about 34 channels, only 5 are relevant to development. I'd like to be able to mute all the other channels.

I'd also like it to not use my Discord settings to do this, as I participate in more than those 5 channels, I just don't want to be distracted by them while doing development. Although, if it used those settings and allowed you to mute more channels that would also be fine.

Edit: I see muted channels referenced in the code. Perhaps I have simply missed how to do so.

Edit 2: I don't see any way to search the Discord docs either, but I don't actually see anywhere in there where you can get a user's muted channels, and the code looks like it is pulling channel categories and checking if they are muted rather than channels themselves.

Here is the output from adding `console.log(channelId + " " + name + " " + muted);` to `src/discord/index.ts`'s `fetchChannels` `forEach(channel)` loop.
```text
499165904337371156 Support false
index.ts:304
442750940248932384 IR Development false
index.ts:304
438697858150170625 Item Randomizer false
index.ts:304
529096466233557002 Admin false
index.ts:304
438699161215434752 Beta Quest false
index.ts:304
474510488840044566 Misc false
index.ts:304
360720521807003648 Mods false
index.ts:304
360720102225739778 Races false
index.ts:304
455423953142415371 IR restreaming false
index.ts:304
390442958673018880 Archive false
index.ts:304
528219671242211341 AFK false
index.ts:304
360714953348481035 Vocal true
index.ts:304
502399817016803344 Active channel false
index.ts:304
528219558096535559 Private vocals false
```

Here is an image of my sidebar with a couple of the categories expanded. (sorry for huge, I use a HiDPI display)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/634079/51070245-33716980-160c-11e9-8628-71d1f5951db3.png)

And here is an image of my channels in Discord itself.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/634079/51070322-6831f080-160d-11e9-90fa-f8804a9477fa.png)

As you can see, I have all the channels in the Item Randomizer category except for the support and suggestions channels muted, yet they are all giving unread notifications.

Seems this may be more of a bug report than a feature request? I definitely never mute categories as, again, I like to participate in many of these channels. I just don't want to be distracted by irrelevant channel notifications while doing development work.

title: Handle slack token invalid situation
body:
when a token is invalid, we keep making API calls and they will keep failing. this is not ideal - we should either remove the token altogether, or at least ask for a new token.

somewhat related to #79

title: html encoding appearing in code block
body:
if a slack message contains a code block with html entity characters, such as:
```
a < b
```

it'll appear in the vscode slack window like this:
```
a < b
```

title: Live share chat does not work
body:
Reported by @ffxsam in https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/live-share/issues/69#issuecomment-431487596

> It's a shame the chat extension doesn't work for me. The input box just says "Message undefined" and nothing works.

It looks like an initialization problem with the `vsls.SharedService`. We also know that the chat channel was not defined, which means the initialization failed before the channel setup.

@ffxsam - could you tell me if you were the guest or the host in this session? Also, which version of the live share extension was being used by you and the host?

title: Massive privacy violation: automatically posts Live Share link in connected Discord
body:
I installed the extension so that I could monitor chatrooms in a Discord guild through VS Code. I provided it with my private auth token, trusting that this would only be used to allow the extension to connect to Discord and not be abused.

Recently, I noticed I wasn't signed in on Live Share, so for the heck of it I signed in using my Microsoft work account while I was connected to Discord through VS Code. I found out later that a Live Share link had been posted automatically through my account in the Discord chat I was connected to, and that it had been there for hours. That link revealed my full name to anyone who followed it.

I'm not sure what exact version I had installed as I've now removed this extension, but it's likely the most recent one as of the time of writing. I'm using 64-bit Windows 10.

title: Feedback on Discord support
body:
I didn't want to open a bunch of issues at once, so I figured I'd just make a list.

- Let the user switch between servers after they've chosen one (this is possible via the command palette with "Switch workspace", but it'd be nice to have it in the sidebar)
- Ability to edit/delete messages inline.
- Display custom emotes
- Don't include voice channels in the channels list (or include them, but give them a special icon and gray them out to show they can't be used)
- Show image posts (maybe just links to them?)
- Tokens expire pretty quickly, I wonder if it's possible to get into the RPC beta?

title: Messages not sent to Slack
body:
I'm not sure if I should have posted this comment on #74 but as I think the cause is likely different I decided to open a new ticket. I authorized the app with slack and It's showing my rooms and group chats properly, the only issue is it does not send any messages I type to the slack server. None of them ever show up to my other users. I recorded a gif to show you: 
![screen recording 2018-10-11 at 01 33 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1036810/46822906-c1625d80-cd5a-11e8-9ec6-b5fc55cc3dc6.gif)
along with the log output in case that is helpful.

And as you can see I'm able to receive messages from slack, I just can't send any.

title: Usability fixes for VS Live Share chat
body:
With 0.7.0, users can chat with other VS Live Share participants during an active session, without depending on backends like slack/discord. However, this implementation requires usability improvements.

### Initialization

- current state: host needs to start the chat first, to initialize the underlying shared service. guests can join after.
- automatically start the chat service in the background once the live share session has been started, without explicit host action

### Onboarding experience

- current onboarding popup is annoying for users of this chat backend
- how can we use the onboarding tree view for this chat provider?

### Discoverability

- can we use the vs live share activity bar: click action on "participants" to start a chat? (right-) click on a user to start a DM?
- unread notifications: use status bar item to show unread message count

### Other

- users joining/leaving the live share session can be message notifications in the chat window. for example, "xyz has joined"
- how will the chat provider/shared service tear down after a session has been stopped?

title: Feature/vsls chat
body:
This PR adds a new chat provider: VS Live Share RPC. While on a Live Share session, participants can chat with each other, without having to configure a chat provider like slack/discord.

This closes #87

title: Slack: "Groups" is showing private channels, but shouldn't those be in "Channels"?
body:
Hello again,

I noticed private channels appear under the "Groups" section instead of "Channels". Seems a bit counterintuitive?

title: Slack: Hide deactivated accounts from "Direct messages" and "Groups"
body:
I use the "show only if unread" option in my web Slack, so my account is _polluted_ with conversations with former colleagues whose accounts have been disabled for months or years.

I don't really want to close those conversations; there's at least a hundred or so, but as it stands now I can't get any value from the "Groups" or "Direct messages" because it's littered with ancient conversations.

Could there be a setting to not show disabled accounts in the "Direct Messages" section? And similarly, one to hide any group conversations with at least 1 disabled account from showing in the "Groups"?

Or perhaps it might be easier for just a new "Workspace Directory" section showing active accounts only and then I can just collapse/hide the "Direct messages" section altogether?

title: Allow custom server for authentication and Slack integration
body:
So this is more of an "walled garden" type request.  

There is concern from security that the extension runs a connection to a 3rd party server hosted by the developer of the Slack application.  There is no visibility into the server or how it functions and it uses an OAuth token to authenticate to Slack and post/do stuff on the user's behalf.

Is it sufficiently possibly to allow us to control the server part?  Like if we stood up our own endpoint to do the work?

title: Feature Request: Add support for displaying images inline
body:
It would be a great addition to support inline images, rather than just links to the images, in a channel.

For example, in the official Slack application, an image pasted into the channel shows up like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12421693/45732863-2c7da180-bbac-11e8-9c9b-32e641dee59b.png)

and in vscode-chat, the same pasted-in image shows up like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12421693/45732886-559e3200-bbac-11e8-9d8e-f47d4409f4d7.png)

It would be helpful to have the full image visible in vscode-chat, as it is in the official app. This would further eliminate the need to switch back to the main Slack application or open the image link in a web browser.

This is related to #133, as once image pasting is supported, it makes the most sense to also display the image that was pasted in.

title: Feature Request: Add support for sharing files in a channel
body:
Similarly to pasting in #133 -- it would be helpful to have a + button to add files/snippets/etc. and also to be able to drag and drop files to share into vscode-chat like can be done in the native Slack app. 

Adding a + button for snippets may be a first step towards #81 (which would be a fantastic addition itself).

title: Feature Request: Add support for pasting in images from the clipboard
body:
When using Slack, it is often helpful to be able to paste in an image from the clipboard, usually a screenshot, as "A picture is worth a thousand words..." and all that. 

It would be a great addition to be able to paste images into vscode-chat like can be done in the native Slack app.

title: [vs code] Authorizing sign in doesn't sign me into vs code
body:
- Extension Version: 0.5.9
- OS Version: Windows_7 Enterprise SP1 x64
- VSCode version: 1.27.1 (user setup)

I followed the instructions for adding it to our workspace and everything worked fine [(issue ref](https://github.com/karigari/vscode-chat/issues/50)).  I clicked 'sign in' from vs code and authorized in the browser and our workspace shows me as configured.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7635038/45234693-7f9a4f00-b2a4-11e8-80cf-388a1103dd90.png)

However, when I go back into VS code, it still says 'sign in with slack', i even tried manually adding the token, but no luck...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7635038/45234753-a6588580-b2a4-11e8-994b-ee72126ae53e.png)

My settings:
```
// Proxy URL for network connections to the Slack API.
  "chat.proxyUrl": null,

  // Slack token for authentication. Get yours here: https://api.slack.com/custom-integrations/legacy-tokens
  "chat.slack.legacyToken": null,

  // [Experimental] Open bot links inside VS Code. For travis-ci.org, set configuration ["travis"].
  "chat.providers": null
```

title: Incorrect unread count with thread replies
body:
To reproduce (assuming logged in with account A)

1. With account B, send message to a channel, and then reply to that message
2. Open vs code (with account A). Channel shows 2 new messages (which means thread unreads are also counted)
3. Open the channel inside vs code. On focus, the parent message will get marked as read, and unread count will show 0 (even though the thread reply has not been read)
4. Reload the vs code window. Channel should now show 1 new message (which is presumably the thread reply that we did not read)

Upon investigating the parent message payload, the `subscribed` key is `false`. Does that mean the channel unread count needs to subtract un-subscribed threads?

title: Unreads is counting joins/leavings as "unread"
body:
Perhaps there could be a preference to omit joins/leavings of channels from making them appear in the "UNREADS" section?

In my case in the official web client I have it set in my preferences to "hide conversations and channels unless unread" and am pretty caught up on messages but was surprised when I saw 20'ish channels or so marked unread from the extension's perspective.

After checking each one against the real Slack web app, I noticed they all had joins/leavings as the last messages, so I assume it must be that.

title: User presence status should not be cached
body: User's presence state (online/offline) is currently stored inside `globalState` which causes old (and incorrect) presence status to be shown when the data is loaded from cache. While this gets overwritten by the real-time data, there is a delay (perceptible on bad network) - during which incorrect data is shown. Presence should only be real-time.

title: Enable reverse-initiating a Live Share session via a “/live request” command
body:
Currently, Live Share enables developers to easily share their workspace, and coordinate a collaboration session with someone by sending them the session URL. The “/live share” command simplifies this workflow by enabling an in-chat experience for establishing that interaction.

However, there are instances where someone might want to review your code, or collaborate with you, but they would be the “guest” and not the “host”. To simplify the experience for enabling such a workflow, we could implement a “/live request” command, which would send a request to the recipient to share their current project via Live Share. If the recipient accepted, it would automatically share their project, and then automatically join the sender. This would dramatically simplify the act of “reverse initiating” a Live Share session, and is likely best enabled by a chat solution like this.

title: Update dependencies to enable Greenkeeper 🌴
body:
Let’s get started with automated dependency management for vscode-chat :muscle:

⚠️ Greenkeeper has found a `yarn.lock` file in this repository. Please use [greenkeeper-lockfile](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper-lockfile) to make sure this gets updated as well.

This pull request **updates all your dependencies to their latest version**. Having them all up to date really is the best starting point for keeping up with new releases. Greenkeeper will look out for further dependency updates and make sure to handle them in isolation and in real-time, but only after **you merge this pull request**.

**Important: Greenkeeper will only start watching this repository’s dependency updates after you merge this initial pull request**.





---
<details>
<summary>🏷 How to check the status of this repository</summary>

Greenkeeper adds a badge to your README which indicates the status of this repository.

This is what your badge looks like right now :point_right:  ![Greenkeeper badge](https://badges.greenkeeper.io/karigari/vscode-chat.svg)
</details>
<details>
<summary>🙈 How to ignore certain dependencies</summary>

You may have good reasons for not wanting to update to a certain dependency right now. In this case, you can [change the dependency’s version string in the `package.json` file back to whatever you prefer](https://github.com/karigari/vscode-chat/edit/greenkeeper/initial/package.json).

To make sure Greenkeeper doesn’t nag you again on the next update, add a `greenkeeper.ignore` field to your `package.json`, containing a list of dependencies you don’t want to update.

```js
// package.json
{
  …
  "greenkeeper": {
    "ignore": [
      "package-names",
      "you-want-me-to-ignore"
    ]
  }
}
```
</details>
<details>
<summary>👩‍💻 How to update this pull request</summary>

```bash
  # Change into your repository’s directory
  git fetch
  git checkout greenkeeper/initial
  npm install-test
  # Adapt your code until everything works again
  git commit -m 'chore: adapt code to updated dependencies'
  git push origin greenkeeper/initial
```
</details>
<details>
<summary>✨ How do dependency updates work with Greenkeeper?</summary>

After you merge this pull request, **Greenkeeper will create a new branch whenever a  dependency is updated**, with the new version applied. The branch creation should trigger your testing services and check whether your code still works with the new dependency version. Depending on the the results of these tests Greenkeeper will try to open meaningful and helpful pull requests and issues, so your dependencies remain working and up-to-date.

```diff
-  "underscore": "^1.6.0"
+  "underscore": "^1.7.0"
```

The above example shows an in-range update. `1.7.0` is included in the old `^1.6.0` range, because of the [caret `^` character ](https://docs.npmjs.com/misc/semver#ranges).
When the test services report success Greenkeeper will silently delete the branch again, because no action needs to be taken – everything is fine.

However, should the tests fail, Greenkeeper will create an issue to inform you about the problem immediately.

This way, you’ll never be surprised by a dependency breaking your code. As long as everything still works, Greenkeeper will stay out of your way, and as soon as something goes wrong, you’ll be the first to know.

```diff
-  "lodash": "^3.0.0"
+  "lodash": "^4.0.0"
```

In this example, the new version `4.0.0` is _not_ included in the old `^3.0.0` range.
For version updates like these – let’s call them “out of range” updates – you’ll receive a pull request.

This means that **you no longer need to check for new versions manually** – Greenkeeper will keep you up to date automatically.

These pull requests not only serve as reminders to update: If you have solid tests and good coverage, and the pull requests passes those tests, you can very likely just merge it and release a new version of your software straight away :shipit:

To get a better idea of which ranges apply to which releases, check out the extremely useful [semver calculator](https://semver.npmjs.com/) provided by npm.
</details>
<details>
<summary>FAQ and help</summary>

There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html). If those don’t help, you can always [ask the humans behind Greenkeeper](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new).
</details>


---

Good luck with your project and see you soon :sparkles:

Your [Greenkeeper](https://greenkeeper.io) bot :palm_tree:

title: Alternative to legacy token authentication
body:
We could potentially add a sign in to slack button[1] in the extension onboarding, which does the OAuth flow (with `client` scope). However this will require a web-app setup to handle the OAuth redirection, and we'll switch only when required

https://api.slack.com/docs/sign-in-with-slack

title: Handle threaded messages
body:
Receiving threaded messages:

- Case 1: thread broadcast (also sent to channel) - shows up as a separate message in the `channel.history` response, and `thread_ts` is equivalent to parent message `ts`. Also has `is_thread_broadcast` set to true in the message object
- Case 2: thread replies - show up as `replies` in the parent message object, but without the reply text - retrieving them is a separate API call

https://api.slack.com/docs/message-threading#finding_message_threads_in_the_wild

Sending threads: haven't investigated, but the same link has a section on this

title: Mark messages as read
body:
Currently, reading messages inside vscode does not mark those messages as read on Slack. So if uou open the Slack window, the same old messages will be labeled "new". Use the `channels.mark` method in Slack API to mark messages as read.

https://api.slack.com/methods/channels.mark

title: Input field improvements
body:
- [ ] add multiline support 
- [ ] cmd + A is not selecting text
- [ ] shift + enter should trigger a new line

title: Bring text input to focus
body: Clicking anywhere on the slack panel should bring the text input to focus

title: Rendering received messages
body:
Anything non-plain text needs special attention to be rendered correctly. This is a list (probably non-exhaustive) of message types that need work.

- [x] links
- [x] emoji
- [ ] app messages (like GitHub, CircleCI)
- [x] files (uploaded attachments, photos, videos)
- [x] code snippets (inline and block)
- [x] markdown decorations (bold, italics, strikethrough)
- [x] new lines

title: Message edits and deletions not handled
body: When received messages are edited or deleted, they should update in the view. These show up as empty new messages

title: Working with cursor iteration and index
refactor: updated packages to target Angular 11
fix openCursorByIndex, calling cursor.continue do not call next on observable
body:
The method openCursorByIndex create observable from promise. The first call to resolve on the promise do the call to next method of the observable but only once. Once a promise is resolved a second call to resolve do nothing. So if I call cursor.continue(), it calls resolve() but with no effect, the next method of the observable is not called.

My fix use only observable, it's unacessary to create observable from promise and cause this bug.

title: Support for Bulk Inserts?

Hello, thanks for the package.

I was wondering if it was possible to enjoy the bulk insert feature of IndexedDB by not subscribing to the insert events of individual adds except the last one for performance gain?
Reference: https://stackoverflow.com/a/52555073/1835270

If so, can it be specified in the README?

title: feat(service): references #227 and adds additional functionality
body: closes #227 Included additional functions to return the item you just added/updated (the item you are working with).  Additionally a simpler response for deletes that returns a successful `true`

title: Must manually parse through all items after an update/delete causes extra work
Added getAllKeysByIndex method to service
body:
Fixes: #225

Currently there wasn't a clear way to query the database for multiple records without pulling in all the data for those records into memory (see #225 )

Therefore, have added a new variant of `getAllByIndex` named `getAllKeysByIndex` which uses `openKeyCursor` to return the primary keys of a query rather than `openCursor` which returns the full content.

This provides a quick way to return query results in a lightweight way, and may be more generally useful to others so issuing a PR.

title: Move generic type to methods?
body:
Great library!

I noticed that the generic type is defined on the class.

```typescript
export class NgxIndexedDBService<T = any>
```

However, all methods take the object store name as a parameter. When using the service, I would like to access different object stores. Wouldn't it be better to place the generic type on the methods? e.g.

```typescript
getAll<T>(storeName: string): Observable<T[]>
```

Or am I supposed to use the service differently?

Thanks :)

title: getAll is not called after subscription
body:
Hi!
The default RxJs behavior is subscribe until `subscriber.complete()` (https://rxjs-dev.firebaseapp.com/guide/observable). `getAll` is not called after the subscription. 

I have made a stackblitz with the regular RxJs behavior and a `getAll` call in comparison:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-indexdb-demo-4yby57?file=src/app/app.component.ts

Maybe I misunderstand, what's the point of `getAll` returning an observable and not a promise? Or how can I change this behavior?
Thanks in advance!

title: Open Cursor and Open Cursor By Index Assumes ReadOnly Mode of Transactions.
body:
https://github.com/assuncaocharles/ngx-indexed-db/blob/master/projects/ngx-indexed-db/src/lib/ngx-indexed-db.service.ts
Assumes that someone is opening a cursor for reading data:

>  const transaction = createTransaction(db, optionsGenerator(**DBMode.readonly**, storeName, reject, resolve));

Instead of hard coding this the user should be allowed to pick and choose the transaction mode. Should be passed in createCursor and createCursorIndex as parameters. 

Here is my code:

> 
> this.dbService.openCursorByIndex("entries", "clickers", IDBKeyRange.only(this.clicker.id.toString()),(evt) => {
>             var cursor = (<any>evt.target).result;
>             if (cursor) {
>                 cursor.delete();
>                 cursor.continue();
>             }});

And here is the error it produces:

core.js:4127 ERROR DOMException: Failed to execute 'delete' on 'IDBCursor': The record may not be deleted inside a read-only transaction.
    at http://localhost:4200/views-tickers-tickers-module.js:1751:30
    at IDBRequest.__zone_symbol__ON_PROPERTYsuccess (http://localhost:4200/views-tickers-tickers-module.js:1075:21)
    at IDBRequest.wrapFn (http://localhost:4200/polyfills.js:11772:43)
    at ZoneDelegate.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (http://localhost:4200/polyfills.js:10923:35)
    at Object.onInvokeTask (http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:70745:33)
    at ZoneDelegate.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (http://localhost:4200/polyfills.js:10922:40)
    at Zone.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.Zone.runTask (http://localhost:4200/polyfills.js:10690:51)
    at ZoneTask.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.ZoneTask.invokeTask [as invoke] (http://localhost:4200/polyfills.js:11005:38)
    at invokeTask (http://localhost:4200/polyfills.js:12173:18)
    at IDBRequest.globalZoneAwareCallback (http://localhost:4200/polyfills.js:12199:21)

I think we need to provide the users an ability to decide in which mode they want to open transactions / cursors?

Happy to provide this Pull Request if you agree with this change.

title: feat(ObjectStoreMeta): make 'keyPath' optional.
body:
I am new to IndexedDB but looks like you have to set `keyPath` to null if you want to use your own key. That's why this PR sets the keyPath property to optional.

See: https://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/#dom-idbobjectstore-keypath

title: getByIndex always undefined
body:
Hello,

I am trying to get an object by an index, but it is not working.

```
const dbConfig: DBConfig = {
    name: 'DB',
    version: 1,
    objectStoresMeta: 
    [{
        store: 'docmetaDetails',
        storeConfig: { keyPath: 'id', autoIncrement: false },
        storeSchema: [
            { name: 'uuid', keypath: 'uuid', options: { unique: true } },
            { name: 'data', keypath: 'data', options: { unique: false } }
        ]
    }]
};
```

If I try to receive the object with the following code, I always get an undefined object.
`this._db.getByIndex('docmetaDetails', 'uuid', 'c34a4d9f-8a87-4e1e-bf53-927924bfe728');`

If I try to get all Elements with the following code I can see that the element is present.
`this._db.getAll('docmetaDetails');`

![IndexedDB_getAll_2020-08-20 123136](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2017880/90759796-3c92e400-e2e1-11ea-9255-841062319d7a.png)


Do you know what the problem is?

Best regards

title: IE 11 throwing error on getAll
body:
I am getting an error on IE 11 while using this package. It is working fine on Chrome though. Do I need to add some work around for IE 11 or am I missing something else? 

TypeError: Object doesn't support property or method 'getAll'

Code:  this.dbService.getAll('messages').then(...)

PS: I am not sure if i am supposed to create this as an issue, but after much looking around, I wasn't able to find a solution and didn't find any other way to reach out.

Thanks in advance.

title: Fix wrong catch statement
body:
In #193 I've added a catch statement at the wrong line (method `deleteDatabase`).
This fix introduces the correct use of `then/catch` for the mentioned method. 

Could you please double check?

title: Add missing catch statements
body:
Method openDatabase returns a Promise which could be rejected.
All calls (but one - method `getAllByIndex`) to it didn't have a catch statement, therefore the returned Promise never got resolved or rejected.

This PR adds the missing catch statements, should fix #103

title: Save data to keypath
body:
Hi.

I need to save the date of each day in the keypath.
I have for example 1.000.000 records and each one has its date and time. I group them by date and that array that I have of a date I need to keep it in a row of the indexed db. I have managed to insert the array but with autoincrement = true. But I need it to be false and in the keypath I need to put the date.

Another way I have tried has been to record by record, but it is very slow to enter 1.000.000 records one by one.

There is no possibility to open a transaction and enter the 1.000.000 rows and then close the transaction?

For example in SQL Server, can you do bulk, in indexed db and the angular plugin, can you?

title: fix(service): fix getById to work with strings
body:
`NgxIndexedDBService.getById` method shouldn't transform string key into number.
This causes problems when autoincrement on primary key is disabled (ie: keys are UUIDs).

Release Notes for v5.0.0

5.0.0 (2020-04-09)

Bug Fixes

  • install semantic-release as a regular dev dependency (#3455) (1eaf35e)
  • ci: echo travis env that gates release after_success (#3446) (b8b2ed8)
  • ci: poll every 10s to avoid rate limit. (#3388) (91e7e00)
  • middleware/runner: handle file list rejections (#3400) (80febfb), closes #3396 #3396
  • server: cleanup import of the removed method (#3439) (cb1bcbf)
  • server: createPreprocessor was removed (#3435) (5c334f5)
  • server: detection new MS Edge Chromium (#3440) (7166ce2)
  • server: replace optimist on yargs lib (#3451) (ec1e69a), closes #2473
  • server: Report original error message (#3415) (79ee331), closes #3414

Code Refactoring

  • use native Promise instead of Bluebird (#3436) (33a069f), closes /github.com/karma-runner/karma/pull/3060#discussion_r284797390

Continuous Integration

  • drop node 8, adopt node 12 (#3430) (a673aa8)

Features

  • docs: document DEFAULT_LISTEN_ADDR constant (#3443) (057d527), closes #2479
  • karma-server: added log to the server.js for uncaught exception (#3399) (adc6a66)
  • preprocessor: obey Pattern.isBinary when set (#3422) (708ae13), closes #3405

BREAKING CHANGES

  • Karma plugins which rely on the fact that Karma uses Bluebird promises may break as Bluebird-specific API is no longer available on Promises returned by the Karma core
  • server: Deprecated createPreprocessor removed, karma-browserify < 7 version doesn't work
  • no more testing on node 8.

title: Angular Universal (SSR) compatibility
body:
My merge request contains minor changes to allow 
* Import of `NgxIndexedDBModule` without errors running the universal express server
* Small refactoring of `CreateObjectStore` and `openDatabase`.

The problem basically was, that the node server, which serves the Angular Application, tried to access the `window.indexedDB`, which is obviously only available in the browser. So the `NgxIndexedDBService` basically only loads the indexedDB, when we use it in a browser.

Here is some further read: https://github.com/angular/universal/blob/master/docs/gotchas.md

title: Make lib compatible with ng9
body:
If we do an ng update, this give error because the peer dependencies are ng 8.
This pull request migrates lib to ng 9 and mark it compatible with ng 8 and ng 9.

title: lacking API for getAll by index
body: There is a `getAll` and a single `getByIndex`, but the API lacks a method for retrieving all items in an index.

title: Prevent race condition on creation of database
body:
The creation of the database is done in your forroot that call the ngx indexed db service constructor which create the db in asynchronous action. If some code try to access the database, the database might not be created.
A solution is to create a separate method to create the database with async return like promise and call this method in an APP_INITILAZER provider in your module.

title: Example confusion
body:
Your migration example isn't making any sense to me.  You're grabbing the people table, and then adding an index on country and age...neither of which are shown as being columns in the tables.

Also, what's the difference between name and keypath on the storeSchema?  Seems like they're just always the same.

title: In the document getAll has 3 parameters but cannot find in code
deleteDatabase taking long time
body:
I'm adding thousands of items into IndexedDB. When trying to delete database with deleteDatabase(), returned Promise can take minutes to resolve. I did research about this issue and I think this is because database connections are not closed. And only after browser garbage collection is finished database is deleted.

What do you think, would closing connections after inserting / getting from IndexedDB improve this? Any change of getting it implemented?

title: Handling of database deletion while app is running
body:
If the indexeddb is deleted during app lifetime for any reasons, the next query to indexeddb leads to its recreation with no stores but the correct version number.
In such situation, the only way to recover is to delete the database manually again and to restart the app while in such situation (0 stores and Missing store error), the CreateObjectStore method should be called.

greg

title: Changed API to have the store name passed as a parameter instead of using a property
body:
This resolves #107 

I've bumped version to 3.0.0 because it's a breaking change.

title: Compile-time error with code in Readme.md (and solution)
body:
# Overview
In the README.md file the first code sample has the following:

```
import { NgxIndexedDBModule } from 'ngx-indexed-db';

const dbConfig: DBConfig  = {
```

This produces the following error:

```
ERROR in src/app/app.module.ts:13:17 - error TS2304: Cannot find name 'DBConfig'.
```

# Repro
1. Start a new Angular project.
2. Add the ng-indexed-db module.
2. Modify the Angular project with the first code sample from this project's README.md

# Expected
That I get no compile-time warnings.

# Actual
I get a compile time warning that it can't find 'DBConfig'.

# Proposed Solution
I'm not very familiar with TypeScript or Angular, so takes this with a grain of salt, but when I added an import for DBConfig then the problem went away:

```
import { NgxIndexedDBModule } from 'ngx-indexed-db';
import { DBConfig } from 'ngx-indexed-db';

const dbConfig: DBConfig  = {
```

There might be a better way to do this...

title: Working with multiple stores in new version.
body:
Hi,
We have a multiple stores and one dao service for using indexxed db. On earlier versions (ex. 2.6.1) for getting for ex. fruits we have used getAll('friutsstore') . But for latest version as far as understand we must have ngxindexeddb service which keeps current store name inside service. How we can use with multiple stores on latest versions? Could we create multiple dbservices for every stores?
Thank you.

title: fix(migrations): added support for aot
body:
The initial version didn't support ahead of time compilation. This version uses a factory function, which seems to be the common practice for other libraries. 

I apologize again for not catching this the first time.

title: Firefox not working
body:
I have this all set up nicely, works for chrome and safari, however Firefox doesnt seem to work.

It breaks on 
db.openDatabase

After digging around, the error reported is
**InvalidStateError: A mutation operation was attempted on a database that did not allow mutations.**

[stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17175741/invalidstateerror-a-mutation-operation-was-attempted-on-a-database-that-did-not)

title: _this.dbService.delete is not a function
body: while making delete operation. it crashes with message _this.dbService.delete is not a function

title: Added basic support for migrations
body:
This allows you to pass in handlers for each db version. It will apply every version greater than the old version. 

The down side to this is that it bypasses the abstraction for the migration handlers. I debated if I wanted to attempt to abstract this in any way, but decided it was best to allow the underlying objects to be exposed for greater migration flexibility.

I am not sure if this is inline with what you had in mind, so feel free to reject this, but the latest version was unusable for me without the ability to apply migrations between versions.

title: Adding Data to Multiple Stores Sequentially
body:
Is it possible to add data to object stores sequentially? I have an issue where I need to add data to different stores, but the data just gets added to the store that was last set and throws an error:

```
Error: Uncaught (in promise): Event: {"isTrusted":true}
```

Here is a [StackBlitz example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-indexed-db-stackoverflow-question?file=src%2Fapp%2Foffline-data.service.ts)

Thanks

title: An array of strings was added as an option to keypath
body: Hi, i think it would be this simple, but as i said, haven't been able to verify it

title: can a compound key be used?
body:
Hi,

So, the native indexed-db can use a array as keypath. Could this be added? currently it's acepting a string only, would it break anything?

Would compile and do a pull request, but haven't been able to run ng test successfully...

title: Multiple object store
body: How can I create multiple object stores?

title: Migration: getByKey has been removed
body:
Hi !
I was looking into this lib and noticed that the getByKey function is not available (yet?) in the NgxIndexedDBService. It was in previous versions, but since the refactor it's just gone. Even though it's still referenced in the documentation.

I get that the 3.0 is probably still in progress since there was no release yet, but I thought it was a good idea to point it out.

Release Notes for Theme Update and More

Features ✨

  • Updates included in typedoc-default-themes v0.6.0
  • Mixin support (#990)
  • Category improvements (#938)
  • Default CLI output directory to ./docs (#970)
  • Expand JS files if allowJS is enabled (#948)
  • Add support for excluding directories and refactor expandInputFiles. (#730)
  • Move non-exported types to devdependencies (#1035)
  • Support negations in directory excludes (92f0f25)
  • Performance: Allow TraverseCallback to bail out early (#1034)

Fixes 🐛

  • Reset the state of the comment plugin on conversion start. (#1006)
  • Fix handlebars types conflict (#967)
  • Fix reference to deprecated handlebars type (#1022)
  • Fix bug with the negated/commented exclude patterns (#1025)
  • Fix references marked as external if path has dots (#1052)
  • Category fixes (#1008)

Documentation help 📖

  • Use https in links (#982)
  • Add documentation contributing instructions (#973)
  • Change some typos and sentence structure in CONTRIBUTING.md (#968)
  • Add excludeNotExported to README (#997)

Changed 📦

  • Update dependencies (#992) (#1041)
  • Update typedoc-default-themes to latest (#993)
  • Update typescript to 3.4.x (#1014)
  • Update typescript to 3.5.x (#1047)
  • Update marked to 0.6.0 to support id generation for headers (#966)
  • Update marked to 0.7.0 (e9b28ee)
  • npm audit fix (#1019)
  • Updated lodash to 4.17.15 to avoid prototype pollution (b328537)
  • Reduce reliance on internal TS apis (#949)
  • Replace array indexOf checks with includes (#954)
  • Remove Grunt (#933)
  • Run CI on current Node.js versions (#1053)
  • Modify example script permissions (#1011)

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot ignore this [patch|minor|major] version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor/major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language

If you don’t accept this pull request, your project will work just like it did before. However, you might be missing out on a bunch of new features, fixes and/or performance improvements from the dependency update. ---
Release Notes for 0.7.0

Security

  • Sanitize paragraph and text tokens #1504
  • Fix ReDOS for links with backticks (issue #1493) #1515

Breaking Changes

  • Deprecate sanitize and sanitizer options #1504
  • Move fences to CommonMark #1511
  • Move tables to GFM #1511
  • Remove tables option #1511
  • Single backtick in link text needs to be escaped #1515

Fixes

  • Fix parentheses around a link #1509
  • Fix headings (issue #1510) #1511

Tests

The new version differs by 36 commits.

There are 36 commits in total.

title: Error on Event isTrusted
body:
Hi,

I am getting an error in using db.add function with angular7 implementation:
**ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): Event: {"isTrusted":true}**
    at M (polyfills.6730d4c9a2c69ac6cad9.js:1)
    at polyfills.6730d4c9a2c69ac6cad9.js:1
    at IDBTransaction.abort [as __zone_symbol__ON_PROPERTYabort] (4.26eb8e265adffe5bd9d5.js:1)
    at IDBTransaction.O (polyfills.6730d4c9a2c69ac6cad9.js:1)
    at t.invokeTask (polyfills.6730d4c9a2c69ac6cad9.js:1)
    at Object.onInvokeTask (main.08bd23ad706e75f29b00.js:1)
    at t.invokeTask (polyfills.6730d4c9a2c69ac6cad9.js:1)
    at e.runTask (polyfills.6730d4c9a2c69ac6cad9.js:1)
    at e.invokeTask [as invoke] (polyfills.6730d4c9a2c69ac6cad9.js:1)
    at m (polyfills.6730d4c9a2c69ac6cad9.js:1)

Any idea? It doesn't add to my indexedDB table.

title: NPM packages are broken (2.0.0+)
body:
The published packages contain only the source code.
Therefore it is not possible to use any package with version 2.0.0+

```
.
├── angular.json
├── docs
│   ├── assets
│   │   ├── css
│   │   │   ├── main.css
│   │   │   └── main.css.map
│   │   ├── images
│   │   │   ├── icons@2x.png
│   │   │   ├── icons.png
│   │   │   ├── widgets@2x.png
│   │   │   └── widgets.png
│   │   └── js
│   │       ├── main.js
│   │       └── search.js
│   ├── classes
│   │   ├── _lib_ngx_indexed_db_.dbwrapper.html
│   │   ├── _lib_ngx_indexed_db_.ngxindexeddb.html
│   │   └── _lib_ngx_indexed_db_.utils.html
│   ├── enums
│   │   └── _lib_ngx_indexed_db_.dbmode.html
│   ├── globals.html
│   ├── index.html
│   ├── interfaces
│   │   ├── _lib_ngx_indexed_db_.indexdetails.html
│   │   └── _lib_ngx_indexed_db_.options.html
│   └── modules
│       ├── _lib_ngx_indexed_db_.html
│       └── _public_api_.html
├── e2e
│   ├── protractor.conf.js
│   ├── src
│   │   ├── app.e2e-spec.ts
│   │   └── app.po.ts
│   └── tsconfig.e2e.json
├── LICENSE
├── ngx-indexed-db-2.0.1.tgz
├── package.json
├── projects
│   └── ngx-indexed-db
│       ├── karma.conf.js
│       ├── ng-package.json
│       ├── ng-package.prod.json
│       ├── package.json
│       ├── src
│       │   ├── lib
│       │   │   └── ngx-indexed-db.ts
│       │   ├── public_api.ts
│       │   └── test.ts
│       ├── tsconfig.lib.json
│       ├── tsconfig.spec.json
│       └── tslint.json
├── README.md
├── tsconfig.json
└── tslint.json
```

title: Update karma-jasmine to the latest version 🚀
body:
## The devDependency [karma-jasmine](https://github.com/karma-runner/karma-jasmine) was updated from `1.1.2` to `2.0.0`. This version is **not covered** by your **current version range**. If you don’t accept this pull request, your project will work just like it did before. However, you might be missing out on a bunch of new features, fixes and/or performance improvements from the dependency update. ---
Release Notes for v2.0.0
  • feat (adapter): Use jasmine's new configure method (#224) (6663e47), closes #224 #221

Bug Fixes

  • adapter: Remove incorrect function and its call. (#183) (cada4a9)
  • return false for every entry is irrelevant (#206) (d7523d0), closes /github.com/karma-runner/karma-jasmine/pull/206#discussion_r186142116
  • console: Re-add Error: to the stack (#228) (d0b980d)
  • time: report correct time since Jasmine v2.9.0 (#197) (022ee04), closes #196

Chores

  • deps: Drop node v4 support. (#214) (e604132)

Features

  • Propagate errors thrown in afterAll blocks (f3fa264), closes #161
  • update the version to 2.0.0 and restrict node version available to 4.0 (c84316e)

BREAKING CHANGES

  • stopOnFailure, which was previously documented in karma-jasmine's README, is
    not configuration option for jasmine. Use oneFailurePerSpec instead.

Requires peerDependency Jasmine@^3.3.0

  • deps: Drop support for node 4.x
Commits

The new version differs by 9 commits.

  • 2dbec13 chore: release v2.0.0
  • 4ddfe2f chore: update contributors
  • d0b980d fix(console): Re-add Error: to the stack (#228)
  • 6663e47 feat (adapter): Use jasmine's new configure method (#224)
  • e604132 chore(deps): Drop node v4 support. (#214)
  • 66f598a docs:(typo) timeoutInterval (#212)
  • 5b45cc1 Adding timeout configuration option (#211)
  • d7523d0 fix: return false for every entry is irrelevant (#206)
  • 3b20480 --grep option now supports real regular expressions but not masks only. (#204)

See the full diff

Bumps [pug](https://github.com/pugjs/pug) from 3.0.0 to 3.0.1.
Release notes

Sourced from pug's releases.

pug-code-gen@3.0.1

Bug Fixes

  • Update with to resolve core-js deprecation notice (#3259)

pug@3.0.1

Bug Fixes

  • Sanitise the pretty option (#3314)

title: Bump socket.io from 2.3.0 to 2.4.0
body:
Bumps [socket.io](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io) from 2.3.0 to 2.4.0.
Release notes

Sourced from socket.io's releases.

2.4.0

Related blog post: https://socket.io/blog/socket-io-2-4-0/

Features (from Engine.IO)

  • add support for all cookie options (19cc582)
  • disable perMessageDeflate by default (5ad2736)

Bug Fixes

  • security: do not allow all origins by default (f78a575)
  • properly overwrite the query sent in the handshake (d33a619)

:warning: BREAKING CHANGE :warning:

Previously, CORS was enabled by default, which meant that a Socket.IO server sent the necessary CORS headers (Access-Control-Allow-xxx) to any domain. This will not be the case anymore, and you now have to explicitly enable it.

Please note that you are not impacted if:

  • you are using Socket.IO v2 and the origins option to restrict the list of allowed domains
  • you are using Socket.IO v3 (disabled by default)

This commit also removes the support for '*' matchers and protocol-less URL:

io.origins('https://example.com:443'); => io.origins(['https://example.com']);
io.origins('localhost:3000');          => io.origins(['http://localhost:3000']);
io.origins('http://localhost:*');      => io.origins(['http://localhost:3000']);
io.origins('*:3000');                  => io.origins(['http://localhost:3000']);

To restore the previous behavior (please use with caution):

io.origins((_, callback) => {
  callback(null, true);
});

See also:

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS
  • https://socket.io/docs/v3/handling-cors/
  • https://socket.io/docs/v3/migrating-from-2-x-to-3-0/#CORS-handling

Thanks a lot to @ni8walk3r for the security report.

title: Repeat button not working as expected
body:
👋  from a githubber

On Chrome (Version 87.0.4280.88 (Official Build), MacOS), using your latest extension.

Repeat button appears to put the music tracker back at the start of the song, but pauses (while I'd expect it to repeat). 
See gif for more details:

![repeat](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13091188/101766907-c3afd600-3ae3-11eb-91dc-21d5d655a3ae.gif)

title: Remote control
body:
I want to control the output of one computer that is connected to my speakers without having to open that computer.

We could allow the server to generate a url that allows remote control from the client in terms of what song is being played on the client that generated the url (and on the client that opens the url, he can see a mirror of the client that plays music in terms of what music is being played and the songs in the library). 

The generated url could just be used to establish a webrtc connection between the player client and the controller clients.

In terms of changes to current functionality:
- We would have to change the player.js::saveState to inform the server of the playstate, which we would share with all the connected controller clients. (The server would have to allow to broadcast the player library information and on player.js::saveState it could periodically also broadcast that state, this way the client's could just see copies of the state of the server).
- We would have to make everything that depends on gettings saving to localstorage on the controller clients to just nop.

What do you think? @benkaiser

title: Add ServiceWorker + Change Youtube and Soundcloud Implementations
body:
This is a major rewrite in how youtube and soundcloud playback perform on the web.

It also utilizes a service worker for storing music completely offline as soon as you have played a song.

Youtube tracks can be pre-emptively offlined by clicking a context menu action.

Stretto now also boots when offline and can play offline tracks all without an internet connection.

Beginning of work for #157

title: Possibilities with cross origin requests enabled
body:
There is a chrome extension for enabling cross origin requests:
https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/cors-unblock/lfhmikememgdcahcdlaciloancbhjino/related?hl=en

Given that can be installed on Android through Kiwi Browser, it opens up a whole world of possibilities for what Stretto can do.

- Can use Youtube DL to get OPUS stream / back it up to skynet
- Can download deezer files / decode them
- Downloaded files can be uploaded to skynet
- Service worker can cache skynet files / all app files to allow Stretto to run offline
- App can work as a PWA instead, no need for React Native alternative

First steps:

- Get stretto booting as a PWA
- Make mobile web experience great
- regular playback no longer needs embedded players, can use soundcloud or youtube stream directly
- caching can be done in service worker with fake cache urls

title: Feature request: Allow importing from YouTube playlists
body:
I have my song collection in a public youtube playlist to always be able to access it at friends places. 
Could support be added to import youtube playlists into stretto?

title: Bump sshpk from 1.10.1 to 1.16.1
body:
Bumps [sshpk](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk) from 1.10.1 to 1.16.1.
Release notes *Sourced from [sshpk's releases](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/releases).* > ## v1.16.1 > * Fixes for [#60](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/60) (correctly encoding certificates with expiry dates >=2050), [#62](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/62) (accepting PKCS#8 EC private keys with missing public key parts) > > ## v1.16.0 > * Add support for SPKI fingerprints, PuTTY PPK format (public-key only for now), PKCS#8 PBKDF2 encrypted private keys > * Fix for [#48](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/48) > > ## v1.15.2 > * New API for accessing x509 extensions in certificates > * Fixes for [#52](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/52), [#50](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/50) > > ## v1.14.1 > * Remove all remaining usage of jodid25519 (abandoned dep) > * Add support for DNSSEC key format > * Add support for Ed25519 keys in PEM format (according to draft-curdle-pkix) > * Fixes for X.509 encoding issues (asn.1 NULLs in RSA certs, cert string type mangling) > * Performance issues parsing long SSH public keys > > ## v1.13.0 > * Support SSH-format rsa-sha2-256 signatures (e.g. so the SSH agent can sign using RSA-SHA256) > > ## v1.12.0 > * Support for generating ECDSA keys using `generatePrivateKey()` > * Minimum for `sshpk-agent` to be able to sign new certificates using an agent key > > ## v1.11.0 > * Added support for X.509 extKeyUsage
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commits/v1.16.1)

title: Bump mongoose from 4.11.1 to 5.7.5
body:
Bumps [mongoose](https://github.com/Automattic/mongoose) from 4.11.1 to 5.7.5.
Changelog *Sourced from [mongoose's changelog](https://github.com/Automattic/mongoose/blob/master/History.md).* > 5.7.5 / 2019-10-14 > ================== > * fix(query): delete top-level `_bsontype` property in queries to prevent silent empty queries [#8222](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8222) > * fix(update): handle subdocument pre('validate') errors in update validation [#7187](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/7187) > * fix(subdocument): make subdocument#isModified use parent document's isModified [#8223](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8223) > * docs(index): add favicon to home page [#8226](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8226) > * docs: add schema options to API docs [#8012](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8012) > * docs(middleware): add note about accessing the document being updated in pre('findOneAndUpdate') [#8218](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8218) > * refactor: remove redundant code in ValidationError [#8244](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8244) [AbdelrahmanHafez](https://github.com/AbdelrahmanHafez) > > 5.7.4 / 2019-10-09 > ================== > * fix(schema): handle `required: null` and `required: undefined` as `required: false` [#8219](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8219) > * fix(update): support updating array embedded discriminator props if discriminator key in $elemMatch [#8063](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8063) > * fix(populate): allow accessing populate virtual prop underneath array when virtual defined on top level [#8198](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8198) > * fix(model): support passing `options` to `Model.remove()` [#8211](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8211) > * fix(document): handle `Document#set()` merge option when setting underneath single nested schema [#8201](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8201) > * fix: use options constructor class for all schematypes [#8012](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8012) > > 5.7.3 / 2019-09-30 > ================== > * fix: make CoreMongooseArray#includes() handle `fromIndex` parameter [#8203](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8203) > * fix(update): cast right hand side of `$pull` as a query instead of an update for document arrays [#8166](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8166) > * fix(populate): handle virtual populate of an embedded discriminator nested path [#8173](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8173) > * docs(validation): remove deprecated `isAsync` from validation docs in favor of emphasizing promises [#8184](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8184) > * docs(documents): add overwriting section [#8178](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8178) > * docs(promises): add note about queries being thenable [#8110](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8110) > * perf: avoid update validators going into Mixed types [#8192](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8192) [birdofpreyru](https://github.com/birdofpreyru) > * refactor: remove async as a prod dependency [#8073](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8073) > > 5.7.2 / 2019-09-23 > ================== > * fix(mongoose): support `mongoose.set('autoIndex', false)` [#8158](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8158) > * fix(discriminator): support `tiedValue` parameter for embedded discriminators analagous to top-level discriminators [#8164](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8164) > * fix(query): handle `toConstructor()` with entries-style sort syntax [#8159](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8159) > * fix(populate): avoid converting mixed paths into arrays if populating an object path under `Mixed` [#8157](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8157) > * fix: use $wrapCallback when using promises for mongoose-async-hooks > * fix: handle queries with setter that converts value to Number instance [#8150](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8150) > * docs: add mongoosejs-cli to readme [#8142](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8142) > * docs: fix example typo for Schema.prototype.plugin() [#8175](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8175) [anaethoss](https://github.com/anaethoss) > > 5.7.1 / 2019-09-13 > ================== > * fix(query): fix TypeError when calling `findOneAndUpdate()` with `runValidators` [#8151](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8151) [fernandolguevara](https://github.com/fernandolguevara) > * fix(document): throw strict mode error if setting an immutable path with strict mode: false [#8149](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8149) > * fix(mongoose): support passing options object to Mongoose constructor [#8144](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8144) > * fix(model): make syncIndexes() handle changes in index key order [#8135](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8135) > * fix(error): export StrictModeError as a static property of MongooseError [#8148](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8148) [ouyuran](https://github.com/ouyuran) > * docs(connection+mongoose): add `useUnifiedTopology` option to `connect()` and `openUri()` docs [#8146](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8146) > > ...
